name: Pacific Fire
description:
Pacific Fire is a realistic turn-based strategy game covering the entire Pacific Theater of World War II. Take command of US, British, Australian, New Zealand and Dutch forces in their struggle against the Empire of Japan from 1941 - 1945.

Features:
- 5 historically accurate campaigns covering major battles of WW2 in detail.
- 3 grand campaigns spanning the entire war, from the attack on Pearl Harbor to the Empire of Japan's surrender.
- More than 80 types of aircraft, from iconic warbirds like the A6M2 Zero and P-38 Lightning to more obscure models like the Fulmar and B-10.
- More than 50 types of warships, including submarines, battleships and aircraft carriers.
- Powered by a detailed and realistic behind-the-scenes simulation of air and naval combat.
- An intelligent AI which constantly adapts its strategy to ensure every game is challenging and unique.
- No in-app purchases or ads - buy it once and get access to all current and future content.

Campaigns include:
- ABDACOM: Defend Singapore and the Dutch East Indies from the infamous Centrifugal Offensive at the beginning of WW2.
- Burma: Lead British, Indian, and Chinese troops in the bitter fighting in the jungles of Burma.
- Coral Sea: Fight the first battle between aircraft carriers in history. Also covers the battles for Guadalcanal and the Kokoda Track campaign.
- Central Pacific: Lead the US Pacific Fleet and US Marine Corps to retake the Pacific and liberate the Philippines in 1943-44.
- Operation Downfall: Command a massive Allied invasion of the Japanese Home Islands in this alternate history campaign.
- Pacific War: Fight the entire war in the Pacific on a map spanning from India to the west coast of the US.
- Rising Sun: A challenging alternate history campaign covering the whole of WW2 where the Imperial Japanese Army and Navy are far stronger.
- Pacific Fire: A massive, detailed campaign covering the whole of WW2, month by month.

Coming soon:
- Playable Japanese campaigns
- New campaigns, aircraft, and warships
- Nuclear weapons
